eea.engine.entity
Class Entity

java.lang.Object
  eea.engine.entity.Entity

public class Entity
extends java.lang.Object

An Entity is a game element that can be shown on the game display.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Alexander Jandousek, Timo Bähr

Constructor Detail

Entity

public Entity(java.lang.String entityID)
Creates a new entity with the given ID. The entity will be initialed as follows:
  • the position of the entity is (0, 0)
  • the scale factor is 1.0 (normal scale)
  • the default orientation is 0 (not rotated)
  • the entity is visible
  • other elements can pass this object without a collision
  • there are no events to be informed if something "happens" to this object, i.e., a call to the update(GameContainer, StateBasedGame, int) method will not have any effect.
To reach a different behavior, use the "set*" methods of this class!

Parameters:
entityID - the ID of this entity
Method Detail

addComponent

public void addComponent(Component event)
Adds a new event to this entity. If the event occurs, all associate actions for this event will be evaluated.

Parameters:
event - the concrete event to be added to this entity

colides

@Deprecated
public boolean colides(Entity otherEntity)
Deprecated. 

Do not use this method; it has been deprecated. Use collides(Entity) instead.

Parameters:
otherEntity - the entity to be checked for a collision
Returns:
true if a collission has occurred, else false
See Also:
collides(Entity)

collides

public boolean collides(Entity otherEntity)
check if the current entity collides with otherEntity The check is performed by examining if the shapes intersect. Note that collide(Entity) will always return false if either (or both) of the two following conditions are met:
  • the current entity and the parameter have the same ID, as determined using a case-sensitive comparison of the output of the getID() method for both objects
  • the system checks if an entity X collides with itself (as a special case of the first condition)
This means that if your application assigns the same ID to multiple objects, these object cannot collide. This may make sense (for example) for shots that cannot "hit" or "cancel out" each other.

Parameters:
otherEntity - a entity that can possible collide with this entity
Returns:
true if the two objects have collided.

getEvent

public Component getEvent(java.lang.String id)
returns first the component (if any) with the given ID from the list of associated components for this entity

Parameters:
id - the name of the component we are looking for
Returns:
the first component in the list of associated components that has ID id, or null if there is no such component

getSize

public org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f getSize()
returns the size of this object, reusing a previously assigned size using setSize(Vector2f) if assigned. This method will never return null.

Returns:
a Vector2f representing the size of this entity

removeComponent

public void removeComponent(Component componentToRemove)
removes a given component from this event, if it was included. Does nothing if componentToRemove was not contained in the list of components.

Parameters:
componentToRemove - the component to remove from the list of components for this entity

removeComponent

public void removeComponent(java.lang.String componentIDToRemove)
removes a given component from this event based on its ID, if it was previously registered as a component. Does nothing if componentIDToRemove was not contained in the list of components.

Parameters:
componentIDToRemove - the ID of the component to remove from the list of components for this entity

render

public void render(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                   org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb,
                   org.newdawn.slick.Graphics graphicsContext)
Invokes the RenderComponent.render(GameContainer, StateBasedGame, Graphics) method on the rendering component for this entity, provided there is one and that the current entity is visible (which by default it is). Note that the rendering component has to be added using addComponent(Component) first!

Parameters:
gc - the GameContainer object that handles the game loop, recording of the frame rate, and managing the input system
sb - the StateBasedGame that isolates different stages of the game (e.g., menu, ingame, highscores etc.) into different states so they can be easily managed and maintained.
graphicsContext - the graphics context necessary for painting ("rendering") the component on the game container display

setPassable

public void setPassable(boolean canBePassed)
Sets whether other entities can pass this entity without "hitting" it and thus causing a collision

Parameters:
canBePassed - whether other entities can pass this entity without a collision

setPosition

public void setPosition(org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f newPosition)
Sets a new position for this entity

Parameters:
newPosition - the new position for this entity, coded as a Vector2f

setRotation

public void setRotation(float newAngle)
Sets a new rotation angle for this entity

Parameters:
newAngle - the new rotation angle for this entity, where 0.0 is the default rotation angle (no rotation)

setScale

public void setScale(float scaleFactor)
Sets a new scaling factor for this entity

Parameters:
scaleFactor - the new scaling factor for this entity, where 1.0 is the normal scaling factor. Values less than 1 shrink the entity, while values greater than 1 let it grow.

setSize

public void setSize(org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f newSize)
sets the size for this element using a 2D floating value vector

Parameters:
newSize - the size as a Vector2f instance

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean isVisible)
sets whether this entity is visible or not

Parameters:
isVisible - if true, the entity is visible, else it is invisible

update

public void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                   org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb,
                   int delta)
Invokes the Component.update(GameContainer, StateBasedGame, int) method on all components previously added to this component using addComponent(Component)

Parameters:
gc - the GameContainer object that handles the game loop, recording of the frame rate, and managing the input system
sb - the StateBasedGame that isolates different stages of the game (e.g., menu, ingame, highscores etc.) into different states so they can be easily managed and maintained.
delta - the time passed in nanoseconds (ns) since the start of the event, used to interpolate the current target position
